intro: Citrullus colocynthis var. insipidus, commonly known as the bitter apple or colocynth, is a variant of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. The plant produces large, green, spiny fruits that contain a toxic, bitter pulp. The leaves are broad and lobed, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It is important to note that all parts of the plant are toxic and should not be ingested.
